MatchedRegions.transcript: Our work is motivated by accumulative point-in-the-ring attack, which utilizes the sequential order property of real-time data streaming for sneaky point-in-the-ring generation.

MatchedRegion.Text: Accumulative Poisoning Attacks 90 Accumulative phase 0.8 clean 0.8 clean 80 Test accuracy before 0.7 poison 0.7 poison (clean) trigger batch: 70 82.09% 0.6 0.6 0.5 0.5 60 0.4 0.4 50 0.3 0.3 40 0.2 0.2 Burn-in phase 30 Test accuracy after 0.1 0.1 (clean) trigger batch: 20 27.66% 0.0 -2 0 2 4 0.0 6 8 -2.5 0.0 2.5 5.0 7.5 10.0 12.5 15.0 0 5 10 15 20 25 30 35 40 45 Static information with current model Discrepancy information with historical model Training epochs
As the accumulative poisoning attack utilize the sequential order property of real-time data streaming for sneaky poisoning generation, we raise the following question:

MatchedRegions.transcript: Can we also explore the information of modal dynamics to gain some useful clues to identify the imperceptible accumulative point-in-the-ring attacks?

MatchedRegion.Text: Exploring Model Dynamics for Accumulative Poisoning Discovery
